body_html:
Same issue on the paperspace.com VM using the ML-in-a-box VM template (Ubuntu 14.04) with pytorch installed using,

conda create -n pytorch-env pytorch torchvision cuda80 jupyter scikit-learn python=3.5 -c soumith

In a jupyter notebook,

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import torch

raises,

~/miniconda3/envs/pytorch-env-3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()
     51 sys.setdlopenflags(_dl_flags.RTLD_GLOBAL | _dl_flags.RTLD_NOW)
     52 
---> 53 from torch._C import *
     54
     55 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: dlopen: cannot load any more object with static TLS

Running the same imports from a python script doesn't raise any errors. Switching the order of imports in jupyter notebook,

import torch
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

also doesn't produce any errors.

Tried to reinstall the env and restart jupyter - for me this is consistently reproducible. Very strange behavior...

raises,

     51 sys.setdlopenflags(_dl_flags.RTLD_GLOBAL | _dl_flags.RTLD_NOW)
     52 
---> 53 from torch._C import *
     54
     55 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: dlopen: cannot load any more object with static TLS

import torch
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
also doesn't produce any errors.
Tried to reinstall the env and restart jupyter - for me this is consistently reproducible. Very strange behavior...
body:
Same issue on the paperspace.com VM using the ML-in-a-box VM template (Ubuntu 14.04) with pytorch installed using,
```py
conda create -n pytorch-env pytorch torchvision cuda80 jupyter scikit-learn python=3.5 -c soumith
```
In a jupyter notebook,
```py
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import torch
```
raises,
```py
~/miniconda3/envs/pytorch-env-3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/__init__.py in <module>()
     51 sys.setdlopenflags(_dl_flags.RTLD_GLOBAL | _dl_flags.RTLD_NOW)
     52 
---> 53 from torch._C import *
     54
     55 __all__ += [name for name in dir(_C)

ImportError: dlopen: cannot load any more object with static TLS
```
Running the same imports from a python script doesn't raise any errors. Switching the order of imports in jupyter notebook,
```py
import torch
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
```
also doesn't produce any errors.


Tried to reinstall the env and restart jupyter - for me this is consistently reproducible. Very strange behavior...
